data.title: 30 celebrities whose real names you won't believe – from Cardi B to Billie Eilish
data.meta_description: Find out celebrity real names including Bruno Mars, Brad Pitt, Cardi B, Whoopi Goldberg, Michael Caine, Halsey, Billie Eilish and Elton John.
data.text:
Some celebrities are born with movie poster-ready names, just waiting to be written out in lights.

Others, however, opt to alter their monikers. Perhaps they’d prefer something shorter, a snappier ‘pen name’ of sorts, or even for professional or legal reasons.

Here, we take a look at the stars who’ve decided on a name change – some of which are quite drastic. Others seem comparatively simple, but just as surprising.

Find out the real names of Brad Pitt, Lady Gaga and more…

Bruno Mars

Pop hitmaker Bruno isn’t actually called Bruno, or Mars, at all. The Hawaii-born musician was named Peter Gene Hernandez at birth.

In an interview with GQ, Bruno revealed that he was nicknamed Bruno as a toddler – later opting to forego his Puerto Rican surname to avoid being typecast music industry as a Latino performer.

Katy Perry

Another popstar, Katy Perry, was born with a different name: Katheryn Elizabeth Hudson.

Perry is Katy’s mum’s maiden name.

Tom Cruise

The Mission: Impossible actor and mega movie star is actually called Tom Cruise… but that’s not his full name.

Tom was born Thomas Cruise Mapother IV.

Whoopi Goldberg

Sister Act legend and The View host Whoopi’s real name is a world away from her stage name.

She’s really called Caryn Elaine Johnson, and once joked that her stage name was taken from ‘whoopee cushion’.

Time wrote in 2011 that Whoopi said: ‘If you get a little gassy, you’ve got to let it go. So people used to say to me ‘You’re like a Whoopee cushion.’ And that is where the name came from.’

Reese Witherspoon

Reese’s unique first name is actually her second middle name.

Reese Witherspoon’s full name is Laura Jeanne Reese Witherspoon.

Joaquin Phoenix

Joaquin Rafael Phoenix, who starred with Reese in the movie Walk The Line, was born was a different surname.

His name was originally Joaquin Rafael Bottom.

Sir Elton John

Sir Elton Hercules John’s real name is totally different to his stage name. It’s Reginald Kenneth Dwight.

Cardi B

Cardi B’s nickname is indeed Cardi, and her stage name, reports say, is a play on ‘Bacardi’, the rum brand.

But she was born Belcalis Marlenis Almánzar.

Brad Pitt

This one’s not too exciting. But did you know that Brad Pitt’s first name is actually William?

Nicolas Cage

The Face/Off actor is called Nicolas… but his last name is Coppola, not Cage. He also has the middle name Kim.

Coppola is a famous Hollywood surname, shared by his uncle, the director Francis Ford Coppola, and his cousin Sofia Coppola, also a director.

Sir Michael Caine

Maurice Joseph Micklewhite Jr is Sir Michael Caine’s real name.

He adopted his stage name early in his career. Caine was said to be inspired by The Caine Mutiny, a drama starring Humphrey Bogart.

The Weeknd

Perhaps unsurprisingly, the Can’t Feel My Face and Starboy singer was not born ‘The Weeknd’.

The Canadian musician’s real name is Abel Makkonen Tesfaye.

Marilyn Monroe

Some Like It Hot actor Marilyn passed away in 1962, but interest in her life remains to this day.

She was born Norma Jeane Mortenson, and later became Norma Jeane Baker by marriage.

Demi Moore

Demi was born Demi Gene Guynes, named for her stepfather.

But we know her as Demi Moore, a surname she took on marriage to Freddy Moore, prior to her marriages to Bruce Willis and Ashton Kutcher.

Bruce Willis

And Demi’s ex-husband, Die Hard star Bruce Willis, also has a slightly different name than advertised.

His full name is Walter Bruce Willis.

Lady Gaga

OK, this one’s probably not a huge surprise.

Most fans of Lady Gaga know that her full name is Stefani Joanne Angelina Germanotta.

The pop icon release an album in 2016 entitled Joanne, her late aunt, after whom she is named.

Gigi Hadid

Supermodel Gigi is indeed a Hadid – but Gigi is a family nickname. Her full first name is Jelena (said to be pronounced ‘yelena’).

Lana Del Rey

Pop star Lana’s catchy name is a stage name. Her full name is Elizabeth Woolridge Grant.

Halsey

Another pop star with a stage name: Halsey is the alter ego of Badlands and Manic singer Ashley Nicolette Frangipane.

Spike Lee

Do The Right Thing and BlacKkKlansman director Spike Lee has an instantly recognisable name… but as it happens, Spike is simply a nickname.

Shelton Jackson Lee is the Oscar winner’s full name.

Jamie Foxx

Hollywood star Jamie’s full name, or original name, is Eric Marlon Bishop.

Reports say the change was made early in his career as a stand-up comedian, to help him stand out from the crowd.

The surname Foxx is said to be a tribute to Redd Foxx, a stand-up who shot to prominence in the 1950s and 1960s.

Olivia Wilde

Actor/director Olivia is known for starring in the movie Thirteen, the TV show House and for directing the teen flick Booksmart.

She’s also known by her Wilde stage name, which was said to be a tribute to Oscar Wilde.

In reality, her full name is Olivia Jane Cockburn.

Nicki Minaj

Rapper Nicki’s full name was Onika Tanya Maraj from birth.

She married in 2019, and is believed to have taken her husband Kenneth’s surname, making her Onika Tanya Maraj-Petty.

Dame Helen Mirren

It seems Dame Helen Mirren’s exact birth name is a little bit of a mystery.

We do know that Helen’s middle name is Lydia, and her married surname today would be Hackford.

It’s also know that, in 1951, when she was six, her Russian-born father changed the family’s surname from Mironoff to Mirren – as a notice was posted in the London Gazette.

But in 2010, a report by The Hollywood Reporter stated that The Queen actor was born Ilyena Lydia Vasilievna Mironov.

Meanwhile, other reports say she was born as Helen Lydia Mironoff, before becoming Helen Lydia Mirren.

Confusing!

Andy Samberg

This one’s not so dramatic. Saturday Night Live and Brooklyn 99 star Andy Samberg changed his name aged five.

His first name was originally David, with a middle name A.J. Reportedly, he just preferred the name Andy as a child.

Vin Diesel

Fast & Furious actor Vin Diesel wasn’t, sadly, named Vin Diesel from birth.

His professional name is Vin, and his actual name is Mark Sinclair.

Miley Cyrus

Miley is officially named Miley these days – but she was born Destiny Hope Cyrus.

The name Miley was born from a nickname, Smiley, and stuck. Now, she’s Miley Ray Cyrus.

Billie Eilish

American singer Billie’s name IS Billie, and her second name is Eilish, too – but she actually has five names.

Billie Eilish Pirate Baird O’Connell. Perhaps a touch too long to fit on an album cover?

Idris Elba

Idris, star of Luther and Thor, is said to be a nickname for Idrissa.

The actor’s full name is often reported as Idrissa Akuna Elba (with an added OBE on the end).

Iggy Azalea

Aussie rapper Iggy’s birth name is just as interesting as her stage name. She is Amethyst Amelia Kelly.

Tina Fey

30 Rock star and comedy legend Tina Fey’s full name is Elizabeth Stamatina Fey.

Stamatina is a name of Greek or Italian origin. The name means ‘this morning’ in Italian.
